meanings.definition: Propounders (noun): Those who propose or put forward an idea or theory.
meanings.sent1: The propounders of the new project presented their innovative ideas to the team.
meanings.sent2: The propounders of the scientific theory were highly respected in the academic community.
meanings.sent3: The propounders of the plan had everyone intrigued with their bold suggestions.
meanings.sent4: The propounders of the conspiracy theory had minds buzzing with speculation.
meanings.sent5: The propounders of the solution were hailed as heroes for their creative thinking.

meanings.definition: Propounders (verb): To suggest or offer for consideration.
meanings.sent1: She propounders her idea during the meeting, hoping for feedback from her colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The professor propounders a new approach to solving the mathematical problem.
meanings.sent3: He propounders a joke to lighten the mood in the room.
meanings.sent4: The author propounders a fresh perspective on the classic tale.
meanings.sent5: They propounders a challenge to the students to test their critical thinking skills.
